If you are looking for ''user help'' related documentation you are looking in the wrong place; this site is for Ubuntu teams to collaborate.  Please go to the <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com | Official Help Documentation]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support/CommunitySupport | Community Support]]</nowiki> to find support information.

If you want to help create or improve existing support documentation or to improve Ubuntu then you've come to the right place.  Keep reading to learn how.

== Getting Involved ==

You have just taken your first step toward getting involved. Before you get started, we ask that you please observe the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/conduct|Ubuntu Code of Conduct]]</nowiki>, it's not very long and it will help you get started.

Now that's done. To find out the best way to get started, you should check out our community page at: http://www.ubuntu.com/community/.

==== Teams ====

The <nowiki>[[Teams]]</nowiki> page contains a listing of all the various Community Teams, links to their Wiki Home Pages and who the best person to contact is.

* Accessibility
* <nowiki>[[Artwork]]</nowiki>
* Community
* Distributions
* Hardware
* <nowiki>[[marketing|Marketing and Advocacy]]</nowiki>
* Quality Assurance and Packaging
* Software Developers
* Support and Documentation
* Training

Most Teams' Wiki Home Pages provide information about who they are, what they do, when their meetings are and how to contact them. Using these pages, teammates are able communicate and coordinate projects.

==== Governance and Membership ====

Like most communities, we have our <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/conduct | rules]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/processes | governing body]]</nowiki>.

Anyone can join and participate in most, if not all, of our Teams and Projects. But if you want an ''"@ubuntu.com"'' e-mail address, it has to be earned. Find out how in our <nowiki>[[Membership]]</nowiki> section.

==== Community Links ====

As an active member of our community, you probably should check out what else is going on in the world of Ubuntu:

* <nowiki>[[http://fridge.ubuntu.com | The Fridge]]</nowiki> posts all the latest News and Upcoming Events
* <nowiki>[[http://planet.ubuntu.com/ | Planet Ubuntu]]</nowiki> is a collection of community blogs

Also you can help at <nowiki>[[http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/ | Ubuntu Brainstorm]]</nowiki> by submitting your ideas to make Ubuntu better OS for everyone.

==== Releases ====

This is '''THE''' definitive place for members of the Ubuntu community to discuss ideas and store team-related information.
